meanings.definition: A set of stationary bells, each producing one note of the scale, played by striking with a hammer.
meanings.sent1: The carillons in the tower rang beautifully during the festival.
meanings.sent2: The church's carillons played a cheerful tune on Sunday mornings.
meanings.sent3: The carillons seemed to have a mind of their own, chiming unexpectedly.
meanings.sent4: The carillons echoed through the town, filling the air with music.
meanings.sent5: The carillons' melody lingered in the listener's mind long after they stopped ringing.

meanings.definition: A musical instrument consisting of a set of stationary bells, played by a keyboard or by an automatic mechanism.
meanings.sent1: She learned to play the carillons at the music school.
meanings.sent2: The carillons in the park were played by a skilled musician.
meanings.sent3: The carillons played a prank by suddenly chiming in the middle of the night.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter rang out like carillons in the crisp morning air.
meanings.sent5: The carillons' harmonious sounds enchanted all who heard them.
